Package com.CZ2002.managers

Class StaffManager

java.lang.Object
com.CZ2002.managers.Manager<Staff>
com.CZ2002.managers.StaffManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class StaffManager extends Manager<Staff>
The Manager class that maintains the state of and handles all logic surrounding all Staff instances in the Restaurant.

This class implements all necessary functionality surrounding Staff instances and provides the access point to all Staff instances in the Restaurant.

In most cases, each Restaurant should only have a single StaffManager instance, although this is not enforced. In this way, this StaffManager provides the only access point to all Staff instances.

The StaffManager additionally maintains the employeeID field of all Staff instances and ensures that they correspond to their index position in entities + 1.

See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • StaffManager

      public StaffManager()
      Default constructor for StaffManager.

      Initialises entities to be an empty ArrayList.

    • StaffManager

      public StaffManager(Collection<Staff> staffs)
      Constructs a new StaffManager with the provided Collection of Staff instances.

      Initalises entities to be an ArrayList with the provided Staff instances.

      Parameters:
      staffs - the Collection of Staff instances that represent the employees at the Restaurant

  • Method Details

    • findStaffById

      public Staff findStaffById(int employeeID) throws InvalidStaffException
      Returns the Staff with the matching employeeID.

      It is assumed that the employeeID of each Staff is related to its index position in entities.

      Therefore, searching for the Staff with the given employeeID amounts to simply recovering its index position from the given employeeID and retrieving the Staff instance from entities.

      Parameters:
      employeeID - the unique identifier that the desired Staff is associated with
      Returns:
      the Staff whose employeeID field matches the given employeeID
      Throws:
      InvalidStaffException - the staff with the given employeeID does not exist

    • findStaffByName

      public Staff findStaffByName(String name) throws InvalidStaffException
      Returns the Staff with the matching name.

      This method will always return the first Staff that matches the given name. Here, the first Staff is the one with the smallest index position in entities.

      Parameters:
      name - the String representation by which the desired Staff is addressed
      Returns:
      the Staff whose name field matches the given name
      Throws:
      InvalidStaffException - if there is no staff with the given name

    • addStaff

      public void addStaff(String name, Gender gender, String jobTitle)
      Creates a new Staff instance and adds it to entities.

      This method will add the new Staff instance to the end of entities and thus uses the size of entities prior to the addition as the employeeID.

      Parameters:
      name - the String representation by which to address this staff
      gender - the Gender of this staff
      jobTitle - the String representation of the occupation of this staff

    • removeStaff

      public void removeStaff(Staff staff) throws InvalidStaffException
      Removes the given Staff from entities.

      This method will update the employeeID of all Staff instances in entities that come after the removed Staff to maintain the relation between any staff's employeeID and its index position in entities.

      Parameters:
      staff - the reference to the Staff instance to be removed
      Throws:
      InvalidStaffException - if the Staff to be removed could not be found
